taxon_name.authority: A. Gray in A. Gray et al.

bio:treatment.discussion: Clematis integrifolia Linnaeus, with relatively wide-spreading, blue sepals, is locally naturalized in Ontario.

references.reference: Dennis, W. M. 1976. A Biosystematic Study of Clematis Section Viorna Subsection Viornae. Ph.D. dissertation. University of Tennessee.
Keener, C. S. 1967. A biosystematic study of Clematis subsection Integrifoliae (Ranunculaceae). J. Elisha Mitchell Sci. Soc. 83: 1-41.
Erickson, R. O. 1943. Taxonomy of Clematis section Viorna. Ann. Missouri Bot. Gard. 30: 1-62, plate 1.
Fernald, M. L. 1943. Morphological differentiation of Clematis ochroleuca and its allies. Rhodora 45: 401-412, figs. 776-782.
